poem:
**Smiths Requiem**

In the cold corridors of could-have-beens,
A note shivered down from Moz to Marr.
Lucrative dust, unplayed guitar,
A flicker in the frost-bitten dark,
Two shadows dance a silent arc—
But some lights burn,
Even when the flame is barred.
